text: Dimbulukeni Nauyoma (born 1992) is a Namibian youth activist. Along with Job Amupanda and George Kambala, he co-founded a radical youth movement known as the Affirmative Repositioning Movement in 2014.https://www.namibian.com.na/index.php?id=131571&page;=archive-read | Affirmative Repositioning – The Rationale - The Namibianhttps://www.namibian.com.na/index.php?page=archive-read&id;=144771 | Affirmative Repositioning: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly - The Namibianhttp://namibtimes.net/swapo-vs-affirmative-repositioning-movement | Swapo vs Affirmative Repositioning Movement | Namib Times He also served as Secretary General of the Namibia National Students Organisation (NANSO) from 2015 - 2017.https://www.namibian.com.na/index.php?id=134165&page;=archive-read | Nanso falls to 'militants' - The Namibianhttp://www.informante.web.na/nanso-%E2%80%9Cwar-not-over%E2%80%9D.17233 | NANSO - “war not over” | Informante == Early life == Nauyoma was born in Windhoek, Namibia. He attended the University of Namibia. He holds an advanced diploma in Banking Finance & Credit from the Namibian Institute of Bankers (IOB) where he served as Student Representative Council President. He was part of the SWAPO Party Youth League leaders who were suspended and expelled from the party for occupying a plot in an upmarket Windhoek suburb.https://www.lelamobile.com/content/40527/Job-three-suspended-from-Swapo | Lela Mobile Online - Job-three suspended from Swapohttp://www.observer.com.na/index.php/sports/item/5710-swapo-draws-heavy-fire-in-high-court-battle | Swapo draws heavy fire in High Court battle - Windhoek Observer == Affirmative Repositioning Movement == In November 2014, three youth leaders occupied land in an affluent Klein, Windhoek suburb as a means to demand land in the city.https://www.iol.co.za/news/africa/namibian-youth-plans-more-land-grabs-1806559 | Namibian youth plans more land grabs | IOL News === ERF 2014 === Nauyoma alongside fellow land activists named their occupied land as in reference to the year of occupation with the initiative receiving help from many young Namibians.https://www.newera.com.na/2015/03/26/affirmative-repositioning-grab-unoccupied-land | Affirmative Repositioning could grab unoccupied land | New Era Newspaper Namibiahttp://allafrica.com/stories/201511260437.html | Namibia: Affirmative Repositioning - the Good, the Bad and the Ugly - allAfrica.com === New Parliament Building === In 2016, the Namibian government announced plans to build a new Parliament. However, the Affirmative Repositioning Movement began to Mobilization young Namibians for a June 16 protest against the decision saying resources could be used in more needed areas.https://www.newera.com.na/2016/04/13/ar-govt-shelve-parliament-funds-service-plots | AR wants govt to shelve new parliament … use funds to service new plots | New Era Newspaper Namibiahttps://www.newera.com.na/2016/05/11/youths-protest-n2-billion-parliament | Youths to protest N$2 billion new parliament | New Era Newspaper Namibia == References == Category:1992 births Category:Living people Category:People from Windhoek Category:Namibian activists Category:Youth activists
title: Dimbulukeni Nauyoma
